Descripcion de la dietoterapia segun la medicina china Documento elaborado por la Fundacion Cornelius para acupuntores sin fronteras, recoge la experiencia de varios acupunturistas. SUMMARY Given the need to comply with the Law of quality assurance providers of Health Services in Colombia , we have been enjoying the meeting of professionals dedicated to the practice most mental disorders in outpatient medical consultation After a corresponding review of the relevant literature, at different bases of electronic health data , we did not find any guide evidence-based in acupuncture for the management of mental disorders clinical practice ; we found a guide to Acupuncture and Moxibustion for Acupuncturists Without Borders prepared by the Cornelius Foundation ( 12). In general the guidelines for addressing mental disorders, a few have mentioned as non-pharmacological treatment to acupuncture and do not recommend its use for non- medical research based on evidence. A draws proposal is based on expert meeting of the Neijing Foundation held in October 2014 for the management of mental disorders with acupuncture in medical attention first level, recommending a practice based on the patient's decision is made on receiving a non-pharmacological treatment such as acupuncture and standardized instruments to evaluate the effect of treatment and patient satisfaction. The guide works with the patterns of the three cinnabar and the three furnaces in human and terrestrial celestial levels of Being, using the wonderful vessels, the points Ling , Tao, Shen, Tian and Shu ancient points to work with the theory of the five elements and Yin -Yan Suggested changes are made in the lifestyle because it is to harmonize the internal environment to be expressed in the external environment in the relational as well the environment. Other therapeutic approaches in acupuncture that allow the therapist to help the person who is suffering mental disorder are mentioned, but all are included in the traditional Chinese medicine.
